message+desc:
[New] I Went For Non-Invasive Teeth Whitening & This Is Why It‚Äôs So Popular 

Don‚Äôt bother with those troublesome DIY teeth whitening kits you see online, this teeth whitening treatment lightens your teeth up to 8 shades in less than an hour for the same price.

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/led-teeth-whiteningEver felt bad about yellow teeth? Check out this quick and painless teeth-whitening procedure to get your teeth up to 8 shades lighter!
comments:
NTUC Dental charges $800+ for  teeth whitening... $180 is reasonable

Bangkok charges around this price haha$$May I have the address & contact number. Thanks$$Wah, the face becomes whiter also!$$Even though there were good reviews for pearl drops and iwhite,  i‚Äôm cynical about such reviews online being totally impartial, that‚Äôs not to say they don‚Äôt produce good products, even though some are pricey. as i don‚Äôt believe sites that review them are totally impartial. 

So i did my own research, there are 100s so couldn‚Äôt decide. However a friend recently told me about a home whitening kit because she had good results. I had to search for it online as it‚Äôs usually only given as part of an after care solution once you‚Äôve has laser teeth whitening, but they now sell them separately. 

It‚Äôs called White Guard home teeth whitening kit, it‚Äôs non peroxide so claims it won‚Äôt damage teeth. It worked really well for me, but that‚Äôs no guarantee it will for you. And no i‚Äôm not being paid/sponsored, i‚Äôm just a regular girl who has no affiliation to any supplier of products. 

I‚Äôm just cynical about independent reviews as the same mags and publications trot out the same brands pushing the same products day after day, do they think we are stupid or sheep. If you‚Äôve found a product via your own research and testing that turns out to be really good, do same as me and add to comments section for such products so that real women like me and you aren‚Äôt being sold the usual suspects and get to try other good products. Don‚Äôt be like sheep and just follow the crowd it‚Äôs 2017 BFN. :)

Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

What is it?
Coron, Palawan is known for being one of the best diving sites in the Philippines, and also one of the most beautiful places above water too.

Fun Fact:
Apart from a diverse marine life, you're sure to find sunken Japanese warships from World War 2 in the waters of Coron.

If you are an active social media user and is willing to go the extra mile for a beautiful shot, may we introduce the almost best kept secret, only known to the nearby villagers. 

Located in the Straits of Malacca, this 'secret island' shows itself only twice a month: During the new moon and full moon. 
The unnamed island is accessible by a 30-minute boat ride from the fishing village of Jeram, Selangor. Besides picture-perfect scenery, the island is also home to a multitude of marine organisms. 

Location: Sasaran, Kuala Selangor (a.k.a Sky Mirror)

message+desc:
Once a year in Jindo, Jeollanam-do Province, the seas mysteriously part and visitors can walk through the sea from the mainland to a nearby island. This phenomenon is caused due to the difference in high tides and low tides, which creates a 2.8-kilometer-long road measuring 40 to 60 meters in width. 

Jindo Miracle Sea Festival is slated to be held from April 25 to 28 in the Gogun-myeon area of Jindo-gun, Jeollanam-do Province. What is your impression of this ‚Äòmiracle sea‚Äô? ‚Üí http://bit.ly/11MoG0d
comments:
i really recommend this festival...it's really amazing and the story behind it is also fascinating.$$Three times a year, Korean people celebrate the Sea Parting festival or as they call it the Miracle of Moses due to a real splitting of the sea and the appearence of a long sea passage connecting them to the Jindo Island, in the three months of March, May, and August.
the story of the Prophet Moses in the Holy Qur'an and says:

So we revealed to Moses, "Strike the sea with your staff." And it split in two, each part like a towering cliff. And We brought the others right up to it. We rescued Moses and all those who were with him. Then We drowned the rest. There is certainly a Sign in that yet most of them are not believers. Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
$$Omo! This is really magnificent! The first kind of festival that I've known which you will cross the sea! (Y)$$Cant happend on November...??? I will there around November...?$$God's creature so awesome,great and amazing!$$I've been there kakak....the place is amazing.....$$Deborah Chua come to visit korea$$Around how long does it stay parted? Is it parted for a day or something? Sounds really awesome!$$Cool. Wish i can be there$$some people say it's like the parting of the Red Sea when the people of Israel left Egypt$$long time i have a dream to reachd there,hopefully one fine day!!$$Really amaziiiing wish I was in the crowd :p$$Ewelina TaheriMilad Heydari u guys should check it out$$Like what Moses did - parting the sea. In this case, it's low tide.

Something about hearing Singlish, the beloved Singaporean slang, always hits home after an eternity of trying to convince the world that Singapore isn't part of China.

This post of 20 Singapore Slangs is dedicated to all you true blue locally born Singaporeans out there." By Joshua Goh

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/20-singaporean-slangsIf you can't understand all 20 Singapore Slangs on this list, chances are you're not a true blue Singaporean. Here''s why Singlish is so heart-warming to us.

Today‚Äôs photo is the Mt. Hakkai-san capped with late-season snow and rice fields in Niigata Prefecture, one of the Japan‚Äôs largest rice producing regions. May is the planting season at rice fields, and the rice plants absorb plenty of nutrition from water and air, and grow tall. 
In autumn, they grow into golden rice plants all over the rice fields.

Related Information;

message+desc:
Do you know what this flower is?
This is called "Takane ruby" which is red soba (buckwheat noodle) flower in Minowa Town, Nagano.„ÄÄNormally, the flowers of soba are white in Japan, however the seed of soba with red flowers were brought from the Himalayas and improved.„ÄÄIt's in full bloom from middle of September to early October. Enjoy the flowers and soba at there!!
Destination guide: http://www1.town.minowa.nagano.jp/html/english/minowa_town.html
comments: Thank you for your updates! So lovely.$$Blue sky and red-ish flowers. Stunning!$$so naturally fantastic and really cool in my eyes...$$Wonderful picture! It really goes to show that Japan has so many beautiful places! ^^$$charming view, make me feel that world is really still clear and pure , hope one day my dream come to be true to visit Japan$$I like this photo.How i wish to be there to see the bloom!

message+desc:
Enjoy shopping!

Each of the three Isetan Mitsukoshi Group stores in Tokyo is filled with individuality. They are hot spots that you will not want to miss during your stay in Tokyo!
Experience the tradition and culture of Japan at the Nihonbashi Mitsukoshi Main Store, enjoy the latest Ginza style at Ginza Mitsukoshi, and find new surprises and discoveries at Isetan Shinjuku, which is a haven for the fashion-conscious shoppers.
More story; http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_mitsukoshi-isetan.html

message+desc:
Tara na sa Tutuban! Apart from cheap shopping, Tutuban in Tondo is also famously known for as the birthplace of one of our national heroes Andres Bonifacio. Take a picture of this monument in the Tutuban Mall shopping plaza as part of your entry for the Byaheng Bonifacio: Biyaheng Bayani ng Bayan contest. 

To learn more, visit http://www.gov.ph/bonifacio-150/
Photo from http://www.senorenrique.blogspot.com
comments: Cool, nice attraction

Have you ever visited national government managed parks in Japan? 
Following pictures are taken in Michinoku Lakewood National Government Park in Miyagi prefecture and there is an area called ‚ÄúColorful Area‚Äù where you can find several kinds of flowers in each season. 
In Japan, autumn is deepening day by day. Enjoy beautiful flowers and trees in Japan.
Michinoku Lakewood National Government Park
Open: 9:30am -5pm (Sep. 1st ‚Äì Oct. 31st./ March 1 ‚Äì June 30th.)
9:30am -4pm (Nov. 1st ‚Äì February)
9:30am -6pm (July 1st ‚Äì Aug. 31st.)
Closed on Tuesday (If Tuesday is a holiday, Wednesday)

Related information;

If you're looking to experience an authentic local culture, going to a jjimjil-bang will be recommended! Koreans have long believed that perspiring in these hot rooms has some medicinal effect in loosening tensions and stress of one‚Äôs mind and body! If you've not experience this, try it in your next trip to Korea! :D

Find out more here ‚òû http://bit.ly/1IXtL7n 

#Ï∞úÏßàÎ∞© #Jjimjilbang #Spa #KoreanCulture #VisitKorea

message+desc:
Accidents seem distant when we hear about them on the radio in the morning - when we're in the safety of our cars. But it takes only a moment of negligence to be a part of these mishaps.

Not everyone gets a "second chance" like the driver in this video, so be gracious and drive safely on the road. This isn't a movie and there certainly is no sequel. Real life requires safer choices.

Singapore Police Force
comments: To add on, pedestrians watch the road and don't take for granted cars and bikes will slow down. Look up and be alert always drivers or pedestrians$$Don't live with regrets just because you need to be 2-3 car lengths ahead of others . It's not only your own lives that is at stake. It's somebody's Father or Mother, Brother , Sister, Son or Daughter  !!!!

http://english.visitkorea.or.kr/enu/FU/FU_EN_15.jsp?nCategoryID=1&SearchType=&keyword=zip-line&gotoPage=1&cid=1019260&cCode=&nCategoryID=1&searchType=&searchKeyword=zip-line

‚òû Korea Travel Phone: +82-33-1330 (Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)

comments:
I'm so jealouse im not there... My heart is in Seoul! North Korea Keep your hands OFF!!!! You've been Warned!$$Where is this? And are you strapped in? This looks great!$$Thats in Gangneung Province. What a beautiful country... Can't wait to go back again and run all over South Korean!$$Video to come! Located on the East Sea at Jumunjin Sodol Beach, Gangneung City, Gangwondo Province. $$By the way North Korea barely registers on the average South Korean's radar as a danger. A lot of media sensationalism cause people abroad to worry, but if you live on the peninsula you will soon learn that this kind of stuff has been going on for years and nothing ever comes of it.
$$Awesome!  How much does it cost and can you travel to here by train from Seoul?$$It costs 13,000 and you can take the train but it takes quite a bit longer than the bus. The fastest route is bus from East Seoul to Jumunjin. Butvyiu can also check out Gangneung City and then take a taxi there.

There is no English yet but here's their site:
www.aranaby.com
033) 641-9002 $$My pleasure:)

If you go post some pics here!

Marie $$Coming from Waegwan/Daegu area, where is this located? I can't wait to do this.$$There is a train from daegu to gangneung but its 6hrs. The bus is faster, go to daejon then transfer to a gangneung bus.

I happen to be headed there this weekend from Daegu. Did you have to book for the zipline or can you just walk up and buy a ticket? They weather looks a bit dicey so I don't want to commit until I am there. I can see something about bookings on the website but my korean is not good enough to understand it.$$Hi Antonia, they are quite busy during the weekends and recommend that you make reservations. Apparently today because of the weather they weren't able to open the zipline, so weather is a factor even for them.

I recommend that you call (033) 1330 (the tourism help line for the Gangneung area, they speak English quite well and have agreed to help visitors make reservations at the Zip-line.  
It is better known as ÏïÑÎùºÎÇòÎπÑ (a-la-na-be) than "zipline". Just for reference.

Marie
$$What would you estimate the drive is from Daegu/Waegwan? I look for directions on google but it only gives me options taking the train and subway.$$Hi Christie, 

I think a rough estimate would be about 5 hours by bus.

Marie$$I use to live in Waegwan/Daegu and miss it so bad. I'm almost retired out of the Army and can't wait to get back to South Korea!

message+desc:
KUROBE Dam is well known as Japan‚Äôs largest arch dam which completed in 1963 and release of water from the Dam has just begun from June 26 through October 26.
More than ten tons of water per second released from the spillway and you have a chance to see a rainbow forms over the spray of this dynamic dam.
„ÉªOpening hours
June 26 ‚Äì July 31 > 6:00 a.m. ‚Äì 5:30 p.m.
August 1 ‚Äì September 10 > 6:30 a.m. ‚Äì 5:00 p.m.
September 11 ‚Äì October 15 > 7:00 a.m. ‚Äì 4:30 p.m.

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histarch/kurobedam.html

Mine especially with an AMC V8 big block pumping out 350 HP riding on 33" BFGoodrich Mud Terrains with twin shocks at the front and a 6" lift kit. We used to drive along the Jalan Toll Ring Road whilst it was under construction leaving everyone stuck in the macet on the side service roads. Fun times$$We did nothing to the transmission and at traffic light grand prixs I'd drop the clutch and hit the gas. The rear diff couldn't cope and with both tyres spinning, the rear right was spinning faster than the left. Consequently it was trying to turn me to the left and the only way to keep it going straight was to opposite lock the steering to the right! This left going down the road crabbing sideways. Oh what fun. I miss those days

Shanghai just added yet another attraction to its list.  The new nautilus-inspired Shanghai Natural History Museum, opened its doors to the public in late April.  

The new museum, which houses nearly 290,000 samples, features a complete four-story-high, 140-million-year-old Mamenchisaurus dinosaur skeleton, plus other rarities that can't be found outside of China, such as a Yellow River mammoth, giant panda, giant salamander, and Yangtze Alligator!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay Island, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it?
With all the water activities it offers, Boracay is one action-packed island. But that doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt find your spot of tranquility. Visit Station 1 for quieter accommodations.

Fun Fact:
The powdery white sand and the pristine waters aren‚Äôt the only things to enjoy in Boracay. There are also golf courses on offer.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department of the Philippines / Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
Wedding Ang Pow Rates Increase To $234/ Pax.

But guests should not be pressured or obligated to give more money just because it is hosted at a five-star hotel.

Here‚Äôs why.

http://mustsharenews.com/wedding-angpow-rate/Here is why you should not feel pressured into giving a big red packet when you are attending a wedding dinner at a high-class place!
comments:
Red packets are a gift by the guest to the wedding couple. Don't turn it into a profit making business. It's your choice to choose an expensive location, it is my liberty to give a 'gift' that I can afford and reflecting my economic ability at the moment. It's a wedding invitation, not a Ticketed dinner event.$$Because Singaporean are being considerate as friends, neighbors and relatives. And because Singaporean fear losing "Face Water", some takes advantage of the situation. 

However, I have a friend (very wealthy himself) told his son (who was about to be married), do not expect the invited guests to keep up with amount in angpows since the wedding was held at top class hotel. And that should be rightfully so. Friends, neighbors and relatives should only present a wedding gifts they meant to be and affordable.$$Every couple wants the best,parents want to please relatives and friends to save face for themselves as well as for the newly web couple.
Remember the package include a lot of other expenses in which the Hotel/Restataunts/Event companies put in.
Actually based on the food alone it should not worth that much.
$800-$1000 is consider high.
So your red package should not be more than $280 per couple or $120 per person.
It is the real market rate.$$Well said.  It is a vicious cycle.  Give whatever you feel comfortable in giving as it is only a blessing and not fair for you to foot the couple's wedding dinner bill. 

Anyway, nowadays, eating less is more healthy. I suggest consider a 4 course dinner instead of a 8 course dinner will halve the cost of hosting the event or consider a buffet,  $10 per pax can help stretch $5,000 to feed 500 guests or 50 tables.$$If you do not have a big head, please do not attempt to wear a big hat which doesn't fit. (Chinese proverb)

Traditional wedding dinners are such a bore! Yawns!$$Someone I got to know invited me to his daughter's wedding - as a group of friends we all attended and each gave red packet - one check the hotel and call to find out how much the table will cost and divide by ten of us -  $100 each - later I heard his Son in law gave him a couple of tables and he made the money himself from the angpows he collect - what a shrewd oldman he was.$$Want to have face hosting wedding dinner at 5* venue then expect the guests to cover the cost? Uniquely Singapore$$No face lah if u expect to have a FREE wedding with the guests footing the bill for u! üòÇüòÇüòÇ$$You are right ,,, so expensive ,,, tell them buffet downstairs Hdb ,,, better ,,,$$Wow... Please don't invite me to your wedding üò¢$$Please don't invite me if you expect me to cover cost$$wonder go to malaysia ahi char what can u get for RM 500 per pax?$$Bei sai guo in liao.(hokkien). not many can afford such a cost. a couple attend a wedding ang pow come to 500. void deck can also do. cost less. more friends less pressure.wedding is sbout 2 person happiness n blessing from friend n relative. Face saving aside. Bottom line Happy Family n forever loving.$$Ian Khoo may the force be with u$$Foods wastage is very high with 8 Course meals. Should cut down to 5 or less.$$This is ridiculous. message+desc:
Where is it?
Banaue, Ifugao

How to Get There:
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

What is it?
The Banaue Rice Terraces are 2,000 year old terraces that were carved into the mountain by the Ifugao people. 

Fun Fact:
The terraces were built mostly by hand. 

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
[New Guide!] 18 Singapore Restaurants with NO GST & NO Service Charge.

 You know that tiny script at the end of the menu that sneakily declares "Prices subject to GST and service tax." I don't know about you, but when I'm blinded by hunger I tend to miss it. 

And then when my bill arrives and I notice the additional costs, I die a little bit inside. In order for that to never ever happen again, here's a list of 18 Singapore restaurants that do not charge GST or Service tax!

message+desc: The Japanese Doll Festival on 3 March is a festival held to wish small girls both health and happiness. Families with daughters usually display a set of ornament dolls representing members of the Imperial Family attending the wedding ceremony on a platform covered with a red carpet. This weekend, several events celebrating the festival will take place, including the event to be held in Katsuura, Tokushima Prefecture which will show a dynamic ornament composed of about 30,000 dolls, and the event in Tokyo's Higashi-ojima which will display handmade hanging dolls.http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/event/traditionalevents/a70b_fes_hina.html
comments: Hello! How to Applay a Free Flight to Japan?? Pls. help, where is the registration web page?$$I love this festival..my Birthday ^^

https://youtu.be/MCzTLWzWVaAJeev Mikha Singh India's professional golfer speaks about India ....
comments:
"..But some elected politicians have already begun to grapple with their responsibility toward sexual minorities, and thanks to the parallel efforts of activists, a small but growing legislative agenda for queer rights has become evident. A new bill protecting the rights of transgenders has passed in the upper house of Parliament and will be presented in the lower house this year. Last January, Madhu Bai Kinnar was elected mayor of Raigarh ‚Äî the first transgender elected to run any Indian city.

Unlike in the United States, where L.G.B.T. rights are an issue too hot for many politicians to touch, in India homophobia is diffuse, and hardly features in our culture wars. And so the prospect grows brighter that Section 377 will eventually be changed through legislation ‚Äî through a process that appeals not just to India‚Äôs Constitution, but to its society as well."

message+desc:
Tamatsukuri Onsen is one of the famous hot spring resorts in Shimane prefecture which is located in the western part of Japan. It is said that this hot springs has the effect of beautifying your skin.
You can also enjoy a natural foot bath along Tamayu River in the area for free.
 
About 1,000 bamboo lanterns will be illuminated by the river from 6:30 pm to 10:30 pm until September 30.
If you stay at the onsen area, borrow a lantern at the Ryokan, and enjoy an evening walk!
 
Location: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/hotspri/tamatsukuri.html
Tamatsukuri Onsen: http://www.visit-matsue.com/discover/south_of_lake_shinji.html

message+desc: How is the weekend going for everyone? The sun has just set on Sunday evening in Korea.
comments:
Check this out: http://insidemybackpack.blogspot.com/2010/06/9-2010-this-is-video-intensive-post.html

and check Korea's Video. ^^$$sad..i cant see wondergirls show in indonesia tonight..but thats ok..im waiting 2pm,hehe$$Sunny day here - but onl 13C$$Saturday was productive... Sunday... lounging!$$Tried to find the zipline out near Gangneung and had no luck... The taxi drivers we talked to had no idea. Any chance on pointing to specific directions, buses, etc.?$$Just had father's day dinner :)$$We went to the zipline today, took a taxi from Gyeongpo Lake. Told the taxi driver it was in Sodol Village and he asked someone on the street there. It was 11,000 won ride. On the way back they showed us the bus stop for Gangneung, bus 300. The bus stop is 700m due west of the beach, you can't see one from the other but there is a sign that says fishery 700m and points east.$$Hi everyone,
About the zipline, this is a new venture so a lot of people don't know about it yet. You should definitely go with a backup map or contact information to show to taxi drivers when you go. 

The zipline tower is right on the far right end of Jumunjin Beach (when looking at the ocean). The beach is fairly well known so that should give the taxi driver an idea of where to go.  

Marie

message+desc:
One of our contest winners Apple Alissa sent us a picture after collecting the gift basket she won for the SG Heart Map @ Park event!

Remember the event is tomorrow at Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park on 14 March 2015 between 3pm to 345pm. It's a free event featuring live performances by Kit Chan, Olivia Ong, and others. 

Grab your partner and join in the fun as we relive our childhood at a kite flying festival and bask in the romantic atmosphere of a night kite display. You can also be part of a one-of-a-kind formation of the map of Singapore with fellow Singaporeans right in the heart of the park.

Thanks again for participating in the competition Apple!

message+desc:
‚ÄúEma‚Äù are the small wooden plaques which can be found hanging on the enclosures of shrines throughout Japan.
Any visitor seeking good fortune can write their wishes on a plaque and entrust it to the shrine, in the hope that their wishes come true.
At some shrines, you can even find unique ‚Äúema‚Äù shapes such as that of a fox or a woman‚Äôs face.
Be sure to write your very own ‚Äúema‚Äù while visiting Japan!
Related Information: 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/d.html„ÄÄ
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/lifestyle/see.html

message+desc:
Bolangir - Serenity combines with old-world charm

Once the capital of the princely state of Patnagarh, the district town of Bolangir, also spelt Balangir, still retains its old world‚Äôs charm and serenity.One of the major commercial towns in the western part of Odisha, the place is littered with the remnants of the past. 

What makes Bolangir a compelling travel destination is its scenic beauty, numerous shrines and the native tribal life. Driving through a thick forest cover to reach any place of interests is a rewarding experience. Many visitors use the town as a base to several places of interest located in the district. Traditional hand-woven textiles life will allure the ethnic tourists. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/bolangir
comments:
We made an online booking of two rooms for two nights in KSTDC Hotel Mayura Pine Top at Nandi Hills on 26.06.2015 and 27.06.2015. We stay at Kolkata. My son works in Bangalore. We went to Bangalore for two weeks. So, we hoped that we would enjoy a quite stay for two nights in this place, as it was very close to Bangalore, only 60 kms away. 
Nandi Hills is about 4500 ft high. Hotel Pine Top is situated in a beautiful place on the hill top in an isolated place. We reached the hotel at about 17 hrs in the dusk of 26.06.2015, by climbing a serpentine hilly road and became exited to enjoy the coming nights. 
When we arrived at the reception desk of Hotel Pine Top, we found that there were some hotel personnel seated near the entrance and some guests were enjoying evening tea and snacks in adjacent dining room. On the way, we also noticed a lot of parked cars, as it was Friday, the beginning of a weekend. 
We informed the hotel personnel that we had room bookings. They advised us to wait, but none came forward. After a while, one person moved to us. We told him that we had prior booking and showed him the reservation voucher. He called another person, who took our luggage, guided us to downstairs and opened two rooms. Rooms were two stories below the reception and one would have to climb down by the stairs by the side of the building. It was drizzling and the sky was extremely cloudy.
The rooms were glass-fitted with open front view of the valley. The view was really superb. There were steps to go down to a garden. From there, vast valley was being seen. The place was really calm and quite. There was a half-circle view-point in the complex, in the same level of reception, from where the view was more wide open.
But we could not stay. When we reached the reception, we found that everyone was disliking our presence. No one greeted us, as if we were non-invitees. No one was coming forward to speak with us. The person, who moved to us informed that there was no room available. No welcome message. Later we found that there was no other boarder beside us. When we informed that we had prior reservation, he told with a stoned face that there was shortage of water and electricity, as it was a hilly area. Might be. Then came the next point. We would have to take dinner within 7 PM, as there would no electricity after 7 PM. Water would be not available after 7 PM, 
We, however, accepted the proposal as we had nothing to do and nowhere to go. But, when the rooms were opened for us, no electricity was present in the rooms. Then we found no water in the tap in the bathrooms with lots of cockroaches in the rooms and bathrooms. Rooms were not clean and linens were not fresh and at some places dirty. It was becoming dark and we were horrified to find that big rats were moving freely inside the rooms and bathrooms. Street dogs were freely circling in the corridor and garden. We also came to know that mobile network would not work there. We were puzzled to think what to do in that evening. However, we decided not to stay in that horrible place. There was also no telephone connection between the rooms and the reception upstairs. So, at night, if there would be any emergency, we would find our way through rodents and dogs to go to reception upstairs, might be no one would be available there. After a good thought, we did not take any risk to stay there. Luckily, Bangalore was not far away.
We came back to the reception with our luggage and asked for the complaint book. When we told the hotel personnel that we would not stay, none asked us the reason, as if it was a better decision. We also noticed that in the complaint register, there were similar complaints by the previous boarders/customers, but KSTDC took no step. We wrote our grievances in the complaint register, but till date, no official from KSTDC/Karnataka Government telephoned us or made any query. We understood that though we noticed a lot of cars, all those people would return back to Bangalore in the evening and none would stay there at night. But we came from Kolkata,a far away place, to enjoy and were cheated. Probably, KSTDC/Karnataka Government does not have time to bother in such petty matter.
On our way back to Bangalore, we found other nearby hotels/resorts/lodges with electricity arrangements. We toured to other hilly remote places, even in high altitude, where supply of power were arranged at least upto 9/10 pm. Nandi Hills is a very good place for 1-2 nights stay, as it is very near to Bangalore. We could not understand why Karnataka Government was not developing the place. The hotel is beautifully placed, rooms are not bad, a big restaurant is attached, approachable road is there and lots of tourists come to this place. Only some developments, like electricity, water and mobile tower, are to be made. Then many other hoteliers will be interested to come to this place and the place will turn into a hot tourist spot. It is a good business opportunity for the local Government and also an avenue for development of local people. Instead of improving the place, KSTDC is charging higher for the weekends. The tariff of a double-bedded room was Rs.1150 in normal weekdays, whereas in the weekend it would jump to Rs.1500, which we had to pay in full. We felt very sorry that we could not enjoy this beautiful place. State Government is turning a deaf ear to the complaints made by the past boarders/customers, as the hotel personnel should inform the authorities that we left the hotel without staying. It was a case of cheating in the part of Karnataka Government. It is known to common people like us that the hotels/lodges run by Government/state bodies are safer and better places than the private ones.
We hope that Karnataka Government/KSTDC should be ashamed for charging boarders/customers without giving any normal basic amenities and should make booking after developing the hotel and area.

http://www.tripadvisor.in/ShowUserReviews-g2289003-d3428129-r306536195-Hotel_Mayura_Pine_Top_Nandi_Hills-Nandigunda_Karnataka.html#

message+desc:
Earlier today, 27 January 2016, Their Majesties Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko of Japan paid homage at the monument of Philippine national hero Dr. Jose Rizal at Rizal Park in Manila.

This historic visit by Their Majesties marks 60 years of diplomatic ties and friendship between the Philippines and Japan. This is also the first time a reigning Emperor and Empress of Japan have visited the Philippines. 

Arigatou gozaimashita!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan."

What is it?
While Filipinos typically celebrate Christmas at home, some get away from the maddening rush and escape to nearby beaches like Boracay. Resorts and hotels prepare Christmas buffets for guests on Christmas eve and Christmas day, so they won't miss the traditional Noche Buena (Christmas feast). This is why December is considered by resorts and airlines as peak season, and you have to book your tickets and room way in advance.

Fun Fact:
Children from Boracay are expert sand-castle makers, and for a small token you can ask them to sculpt one in the shape of your name or your sweetheart's!

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Tin Sanchez

This picture shows ingenuity of this great culture. message+desc:
"THE QUEEN IN MANILA"

The Philippines proudly welcomed the maiden call of the MS Queen Elizabeth last 08 March 2016 which carried around 2,500 foreign tourists from the US, Europe, and Australia. #itsmorefuninthephilippinesPHOTO from the Department of Tourism: "The maiden call of the MS Queen Elizabeth was welcomed by the Department of Tourism (DOT) in Manila last 8 March 2016. Carrying around 2,500 tourists from the US, EU, and Australia, the visitors have toured parts of Manila and Tagaytay. More cruise calls are expected in the Philippines this year, as part of the DOT's initiatives to push cruise tourism in the country."
comments: Philippines is a perfect place for cruise tourism  !$$I hope nothing happens to any of our guests..i always hear praises from tourists how helpful and friendly Filipinos are! There's no denying that Philippines has now become a destination of choice for many foreign tourists for good reasons.$$I love the philippines so mutch with the great nature and the smiling people and i never understand wy you not have more tourismus . ITS a great country .$$Our government should invest on a port facility exclusively for cruise ships making port calls in our country. It need not be in Manila itself given the crowded, smelly, dirty, petty crime-infested port area that we have for many decades now.  Singapore has just built its own while other neighboring countries are expected to pursue the same path and capture the highly lucrative cruise ship tourism. It seems that I don't hear any plans whatsoever by our government to build a modern, state of the art and technology cruise ship terminal in our country in the coming years. message+desc:
Before winter goes away, here is another fun winter activity you can do in Korea: #ice_fishing! üé£

Sancheoneo (trout) Ice Festival is an annual winter festival where you chop a hole in the ice and catch fish from the icy cold water. Be careful not to slip on the ice while keeping an eye on the fish so they won't flop away! üêü

Share your memories with us if you have been there already üòé
Those who haven't, look forward to fishing the best fun in Korea next winter!

*The video has been updated.

#Sancheoneo_ice_festival

message+desc:
Apl.de.Ap There's a special place in my heart for the Puning Hot Springs. Located just outside of my hometown Pampanga, the Puning Hot Springs lay at the end of a mountain pass reached by 4x4 Jeeps. Once there, my friends and I were treated to a pool of natural hot springs and sand spa.
We feasted like kings and queens to a succulent lechon and lovely chorus of locals. This is something everyone must experience. So come experience my country and enjoy.

#IMFITP #ItsMoreFunInThePhilippines #TourismPromotionalBoard #PuningHotSprings #Pampanga #PhilippinesThere's a special place in my heart for the Puning Hot Springs. message+desc:
Kepulauan #Derawan merupakan kawasan Segitiga Terumbu Karang (Coral Triangle). Pulau Maratua, satu dari banyak pulau yang menjadi bagian dari kepulauan ini, menyimpan potensi wisata bahari yang telah dikenal di seantero dunia. Berada di posisi terluar Indonesia, yakni di Laut Sulawesi, Pulau Maratua berbatasan dengan negara Malaysia dan Filipina. Secara administrasif, pulau ini merupakan bagian dari Kecamatan Maratua, Kabupaten Berau, Provinsi Kalimantan Timur. http://indonesia.travel/sites/site/837/pulau-maratua
#PesonaIndonesia #WonderfulIndonesia

message+desc:
We don't normally travel to the East. But we made an exception for Our Tampines Hub - a massive all-in-one lifestyle hub! 

Our Tampines Hub may only be in its first phase, but this massive complex already boasts an impressive range of facilities including a 200,000 sq ft shopping mall and a futuristic hawker centre with self-order kiosks. Sports enthusiasts can also look forward to climbing Singapore's FIRST climbing wall theme part and a sports hall filled up with 20 badminton courts. What more, Tampines Hub also regularly hosts community events ranging from free movie screenings to exciting fun fairs!

Our Tampines Hub
Address: 51 Tampines Ave 4

Never want to miss a post by us again?

message+desc:
The Hong Kong Book Fair is on at the moment and that got us thinking: What‚Äôs the best type of read when you are travelling? 

1.	Pot-boiler (give the brain a holiday too).  
2.	A book about my destination. 
3.	High literature (nothing like a change of scene to finally get Ulysses under the belt). 
4.	Nothing. Travel, like reading, is escape.  

(BTW if you are travelling in Hong Kong at the moment, the book fair is on till next Tuesday ‚Äì more here http://bit.ly/LXi3Dh)

message+desc: Let's not just enter quietly without a word.  Why don't we all introduce ourselves, what is your relationship with Korea?  My name is Marie, and I came here 4 years ago on a whim to teach English, fell in love with Korea and have been here since.  What about you?
comments:
I came here 4 months ago to stay with my husband who is Korean (i am British). It's my first time in Korea so I have lots to learn ^^;$$My name is Ethan. I live in a tiny apartment (I'm not complaining, it's free). I have lived here 11 months. I'm in love with Korean food and I really enjoy traveling the countryside every weekend. (Please don't tell my hagwon the part about traveling)$$Hi Amanda and Ethan!  Great to hear your stories.  Is it your first time in Korea, Amanda? 

Ethan, I'm glad to know you are having a lot of adventure on the weekends.  I was a teacher too when I first came here. It's important to have a passion, travel, photography, taekwondo, whatever it is, in order to have a happy experience teaching.  For me, it was traveling, trying out new food, and especially learning Korean that kept me energized. Do you take photos on your travels? What kind of Korean food is most appealing to you so far?

Marie

message+desc:
Bodhgaya - Buddhism‚Äôs most sacred and significant site
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bodhgaya, the most important site of Buddhist pilgrimage in the world, is situated in the state of Bihar. 
The place is a sacred site of the first order, and its central temple, the UNESCO World Heritage listed Mahabodhi Temple, is an obligatory stop on the Buddhist pilgrimage circuit. 
Adjacent to the Mahabodhi Temple is the Bodhi tree itself under which Prince Siddhartha Gautama is said to have attained Enlightenment 2,500 years ago. As a result he became the Buddha - the Enlightened One. Bodh Gaya or Uruvela, as it was known during Buddha‚Äôs times, is also a major pilgrimage centre for Hindus as Buddha is considered to be the ninth incarnation of Vishnu. 
- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/bodhgaya
comments: https://youtu.be/LqKYyOf80mo

Ahhhh.... those were the days....

message+desc:
Where is it?
Davao, Mindanao

What is it?
Davao is the third most populated city in the Philippines. It's also the largest in terms of land area. There are many reasons to visit Davao. One is to see Mt. Apo, which has the highest peak in the country. Another reason is to go diving in one of its many world-class dive sites. The most popular ones are Angel's Cove, Marissa Dive Site, Ligid Pinnacle Point, Ligid Caves, Dapia Dive Site, Babu Santa Minwall Dive Site, Coral Garden Dive Site, Dela Paz Corner Dive Site, Mushroom Rock Dive Site and Tagbaobo.

Fun Fact:
SCUBA is not just a word ‚Äì it's an acronym that stands for "self-contained underwater breathing apparatus."

Photo by / Headline by:
Alexey Stoyda / Tin Sanchez
comments: Happy christmas Phillipine and Phillipians.$$I LIKE PHILLIPINES I LOVE Phillipine$$Merry Christmas and God bless!$$Its more fun in the phillipines.

message+desc:
Photo of the day is "Rice Paddy Art" in Inakadate Village, Aomori pref. 
When the different colored rice plants grow tall enough, you can see giant artworks like the picture.
It is planted in June and the best time to see the arts is from mid-July to mid-August.
 
You could see beautiful artworks from the observation deck of Inakadae village hall (Open: June 3 - Oct 14, Close: Sept. 29) 
and "Yayoi no Sato" observation deck in "Michi no Eki Inakadate." (Open: June 15 - Oct 14)   
*open from 9am to 5pm (Last entrance: 4:30pm)
 
The arts will change every year, so visit there to find new arts of this year!!

Is there a website?  Or maybe even a webcam for those of us who canot visit?$$Hummmm....I'll be in Aomori-ken in Juy and August.... might have to try to see this.$$This is the website.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron Island is a sure path to natural beauty, replete with staggering limestone cliffs, fine coral-fed beaches, and thirteen picturesque lagoons to boot.

Fun Fact:
The island's geothermal energy causes a thermocline, warming the lake waters up the deeper you go.

Photo by /  Headline by:
Adrien Uichico / Corey Cruz

message+desc: Along with cherry blossoms, Brassica Napus Blossoms are the other flowers that cause people to feel the arrival of spring. Yellow flowers spread like a carpet, forming a picturesque scenery. At Azumayama Park, Kanagawa Prefecture, you can see Japan's first Brassica Napus Blossoms in full bloom. Following their forerunners here, Brassica Napus Blossoms in different locations will then tell the arrival of spring throughout Japan. In some places you can enjoy the sharp contrast between the cherry blossom pink and the Brassica Napus Blossom yellow.

message+desc:
Shizuoka is famous as a home of green tea as well as Mt. Fuji.
The procession called ‚ÄúSUNPU-HONYAMA OCHATSUBO DOCHU GYORETSU‚Äù will be held on October 26th. 
It is a recreation of historical event in the 16th century.

Every spring, as first tea of the season is picked, the fresh tea is stored in ‚ÄúOCHATSUBO‚Äù, tea urn and during summer, the tea urn is kept and made ripened in a warehouse. 
Then in late October, the tea urn is carried to Kuno-zan Tosho-gu shrine and dedicated. The procession starts at 10 am.

Related Information
Shizuoka Area:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shizuoka/shizuoka_city.html
Kuno-zan Tosho-gu Shrine:
https://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/shritemp/kunozantoshogu.html

message+desc:
Yes, some of us may have saw that LTA officer fight video. But generalisng just leads to more unfair hate against those who work at one of the most thankless jobs in Singapore.

Here are some things You Never Knew About Traffic/Parking Enforcement Officers (A.K.A Fatimah)

Because LTA enforcement officers are really just doing their job.

Follow Ladyironchef for more stories like this!

http://www.ladyironchef.com/2014/12/traffic-parking-enforcement-officers-fatimah/It is most definitely a Singaporean thing to call our car park attendants and traffic wardens "Fatimah". We are not too sure how it started too, but the term
comments:
why do LTA motorcycle officers behave like they're Traffic Police ? just what is their training? is it specialised training?? Exactly what are their powers ? does it included any power to arrest members of the public? are they allowed to engage in pursuit of suspected illegal vehicles? members of the public have been speculating all of the above questions and more, perhaps someone could give some insight as to just what their powers are?$$üëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèª as much as I empathize with the pay structure and all. It still doesn't give them a right to behave like they are the king of the roads. Yes, civilians should not try to challenge the existing traffic rules, but LTA wardens should be a little bit more forgiving?  
I have personally seen taxi/Lorry driver uncles running with their might to get out of the No waiting zones . And all I see is an unsympathetic warden pressing with their might on that summon machine like they are playing the final stage of game of thrones. So yah~ whatever it is. 3 million BOoooos üëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèª$$If I was the LTA officer and any member of the public comes so close to me in menacing way, I would have threw the punch too. Whatever the hell is it, you respect one's personal space. You want to scream and shout, you do it at reasonable distance. But if you come right up to my face, inches away, threatening me, all bets are off.$$Problem with Singaporean is they like to challenge public servant. Do public servant owes you a living ? ‚ÄúMatsushima‚Äù (Miyagi Prefecture) consists of some 260 islands, large and small, is one of the three most scenic spots of Japan. Its view changes from place-to-place and from-season-to-season, and is so beautiful. These islands will be covered with snow in winter. message+desc:
[Updated!] KTM Shuttle Guide: Singapore To JB On An Old-School Train In Just 5 Minutes 

PSA: To help you better utilize the SIN/RM exchange rate, Shuttle Tebrau has added 8 MORE TRIPS to its existing schedule. 3-hour jams that make our butts hurt are so 2015.

Here's what you can expect from the rail experience!  

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/ktm-shuttle-guideImagine a train that gets you from from Singapore to JB in 5 minutes flat, for only $5 a trip. Oh wait, that exists. Here's our guide to KTM's Shuttle Tebrau!
comments:
Ey. Just take the public transport buses? You save money AND time. 

No extra tickets required since you're continueing a journey and you already took public buses there. No need to go 30 minutes earlier and all that. Walking distance is roughly the same if you count walking to/fro/within the train station.

There's a reason why the people who travel in and out frequently, especially those who work here and stay there, hardly ever use the KTM shuttle.

Or. You could do a 'challenge. Have 2 of use either methods and see what happens.

Also, if you're using the train to go further (i.e. KL), get the tickets from JB side. A little more troublesome and can only board from JB (so that public transport there), but the tickets are the same amount, just in ringgit, so it's about 1/3 the price there now.$$@thesmartlocal.com why do your "test" trip on a weekday at 5pm? Do a real world "test" on a Saturday morning. Then report on what a breezy experience it would be.$$How to buy the ticket?on line or on the sport....$$Xjingg Lim can take on sat$$Raymond Chan, Yvonne Chan, Chan Vivien. Sound good. Can try.

message+desc: Hotel Bali Beach (Inna Grand Bali Beach) was the first multilevel accommodation built in BaliInna Grand Bali Beach hotel cottages and spa , five star  hotel in bali Located in Sanur Bali, Only 15 minutes from Bali's International Airport.
comments: Actually, Bali Beach Hotel was the first and only ten storeyed hotel on Bali. After that came a legislation that hotels should be built no higher than a coconut tree, meaning not higher than 3 stories. This ruling has made Bali's landscape to remain environment friendly$$I was stayed there in garden wing for two times when i back to Indonesia, the building is looking old but the room is nice n clean, staff are friendly n helpfull, i recommended this hotel you have to try it.$$I much prefer the hipper Hard Rock Hotel across the road. A lot more fun. IMHO. Inna hotels really have to catch up in terms of service quality. They did a great job in Jogjakarta. Am hoping that the Bali hotel has also improved.

message+desc:
Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatouro-2014, a light up event in Kyoto, will be held from 14th to 23rd March at Higashiyama historical area. 
Old stone pathways to several famous temples as Kiyomizudera temple will be lit up by approximately 2500 of Andon lanterns. 
In Maruyama Park, there will be a lot of bamboo lanterns making romantic atmosphere. 

You can also enjoy the dance by Geisha at Yasaka shrine on the following dates: 15th, 16th, 21st, 22nd and 23rd March. 
Time of Hanatouro (Even if it rains, this event will be held.): 18:00-21:30
Destination guide:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/kyoto/higashiyama.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bais, Negros Oriental

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Dumaguete.

Or take a bus from Cebu to Oslob, then take the Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry to Dumaguete.

Or take a boat from Cebu or Tagbilaran to Dumaguete

What is it?
Ta√±on Strait, a narrow, navigable channel of water between Negros Oriental and Cebu, is a breeding ground for at least 11 marine mammals like dolphins and whales.

Fun Fact:
Visitors don't get to see dolphins just swimming here, they also get to watch them playing and singing in groups!

Photo by George Tapan
comments: Which is the male or female dolphin??

message+desc:
Have you ever had Sakuramochi before?
Sakuramochi is a rice cake with sweet red bean paste inside and wrapped with a leaf of cherry tree which is picked in salt water. It is a confectionery with a scent of cherry blossom. Sakuramochi in Area of Kanto (Around Tokyo) and Kansai (Around Osaka and Kyoto) is different. The Kanto style Sakuramochi has a crepe-like wrapping around bean paste and has an oblong shape.
The Kansai style has a round shape and bean paste is wrapped with a rice cake. Why not try both of them and see the difference? (Photo Left: Kansai Style, Right: Kanto Style) 
Related information:
How to ‚ÄúHanami‚Äù
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1202/sakurahanami.html
comments: I had some while I was in Ginza shopping! message+desc:
In the next few years, travellers and tourists visiting the historic Intramuros Manila will witness a more vibrant city, decluttered of spaghetti cable wires, as the Intramuros Administration has begun its underground cabling system initiative, in cooperation with power distributors and telecommunucations companies.

Last week, wires obstructing the sightline of Plaza Roma, from which the centuries-old Manila Cathedral is situated, have been finally removed, giving visitors, photographers, and Instagrammers a better view of the Cathedral.

This is just a preview of the big things to come.
Early next year, as part of the rehabilitation of Calle Aduana, the Intramuros Administration will begin to remove the rest of the poles and bury all the cables along this historic street, while redesigning its streetscape for a more pedestrian and bicycle-friendly environment. 

Photo courtesy of Intramuros Administration
comments: They are getting there$$Wow sana one of these days I will able be to see these type of  historic places.$$Finally!!! not a day too early$$Next thing, pleases remove the shanties inside Intramuros and turn those lands into something historical like a park, library, or museum.$$This is one of the safe and kind to the environment changes the Administration has ever made in the Philippines. Well Done! Philippines is continue developing.$$Bravo! I hope they wont stop there. Its our fervent wish to see the entire metro manila if not the whole country free from these pansit / spaghetti cable wires for a change.$$Aside from the Philippines, my favourite city to visit which is also on top of my bucket list is Prague, Czech Republic. Our Intramuros is giving me that vibe. This is such a great news. Well done üòäüáµüá≠üëçüëç$$I often cannot say what is more interesting in PH, the ingenious cable spagetti or the old church.üòâ$$Underground cable...good job...hope also this can be done to the entire manila and to our country....Pinas$$Truly its more fun in the Philippines! To promote civic consciousness, this APEC, God willing, my students and I are planning to visit Intramuros sites like Fort Santiago and the rest. Are they open? :)$$I hope to see this every place in the Philippines,  these cable wires are not only unsightly but dangerous too$$Please remove the squatters inside Intramuros.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Mt. Apo, Davao

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Cotabato, then take a bus to Kidapawan.

What is it?
Standing at the tip of Mt. Apo would make you the tallest person in the Philippines, since it‚Äôs the country‚Äôs highest point. The hike to the summit will take you through dense forests, grand waterfalls and past some endangered plant and animal species.

Fun Fact:
Mt. Apo is actually a volcano that has never erupted.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Meggy De Guzman
comments: Beautiful morning everyone! I would like to share a blessing to us Filipinos. Please check out www.positivelypinoy.com

Braised chicken with vegetables, also known as jjim-dak is the representative food of Andong, Gyeongsangbuk-do province! Have you tried this dish or been to Andong? ^_^

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bacolod City, Visayas

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila or Cebu to Bacolod.

Or take a bus from Dumaguete to Bacolod.

Or take a boat from Manila to Bacolod.

What is it?
Known as the Festival of Smiles, Masskara started as a way of uplifting the spirits of the people of Bacolod.

Fun Fact:
Electric Masskara, a three-day portion of the three-week long celebration, is the longest street party in the country.

Photo by / Headline by:
Izah Morales / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
Rainy season is over and summer has come! Such a hot day, why not cool off at waterfalls? Osaka Town, Gero City, Gifu has known as the town with many waterfalls. There are more than 200 waterfalls which are over 5 meters in height. Also you will find various species of plants and be amazed at the beautiful nature scenery. Don't you think it is good place to cool off on a hot summer day?
Location guide: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/gifu/geroonsen.html

message+desc:
He avoided travel out of fear and anxiety. But once Chris landed in the PH, all his worries were forgotten. Read his inspiring story here and share with your friends!

http://www.theglobeandmail.com/life/travel/activities-and-interests/how-a-trip-taught-me-that-good-things-can-happen-when-i-say-yes/article27994028/Travelling to the Philippines helped me realize that even when my anxiety gets the better of me, I‚Äôm capable of rallying in a way I never thought possible
comments:
The Philippines has this kind of serenity amongst the busy bustle of traffic and sometimes disorganised caos due to mother nature. It's the welcome, the smiles, the sounds of karaoke sings out through the provinces as a celebration is celebrating with smiles, song and laughter. Oh the foods many great traditional foods.
The Philippines is the place of the SMILE, A place where you can find peace by opening your eyes and ears and just take in the beauty it has to offer. THE BEAUTY IS THE PEOPLE. No matter in their everyday struggle to purely and unselfishly work hard to simply be a provider for thier families. They still manage to smile, sing and dance. A simple but determined culture teaching other cultures the true humble spirit of a country that can not have much compared to most visitors but can still maintain a place of beauty serinity and peace.. 

The Philippines is for the first time where i can say i FOUND TOTAL PEACE. 

God opened my eyes and ears.

ITS THE PEOPLE THAT MAKE THE PHILIPPINES GREAT. THANKYOU.$$I had never visit any country outside Scandinvia before, until i met my fiancee from the Philippines. I dont like to fly but my strong love for my future wife is making the long flight so easy to handle. 
Love knows no distance and love can make you conquer all kinds of fears, thats for sure.$$I overcame my fear of flying for a Filipina. I would risk life and limb for her$$Very nice, it's a touching true to life story on how Philippines views and values moves your heart to re-dream.$$''The Beauty Is The People'' 
Never a truer word said!! My wife of 2+ years changed my life and my outlook on life forever. Virginia üíò$$So many places to travel,from east to west,north to south,keep enjoying your eyes with the beautiful sceneries while travelling by land,good voyage,friends!$$If only the airport is better(including it's employees), we will surely go beyond what we have now when it comes to tourism. It is sad that even Filipinos are not sure of their security in our own country's airport$$the countryside is a safer place to live.$$Good luck to your future travel :)$$Christopher At first glance, I thought it was you in the hammock :D$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RWLNyqzH4Go                                                                                                                                               It has been more than 40 years since the Philippines had it's last Miss Universe title holder and we are offering this Hotdog band song, MORE THAN BIOLOGICAL'S cover of "Ikaw Ang Miss Universe ng Buhay ko" to Miss Pia Wurztbach. A job well done and truly you are an inspiration. You have shown people to never quit on what you believe in, use the talent God gave for the good of many, try and try again, have faith and reach your dreams. You have become the epitome of the saying "never say surrender". God bless$$Chris Harrison read this..

Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron has some of the best dive sites in the Philippines. It's one of the most beautiful places above water too.

Fun Fact:
Coron has some of the best dive sites in the Philippines. It's one of the most beautiful places above water too.

Photo by / Headline by:
Marcello Di Francesco / Cecile Golez

message+desc: The Borra Caves. situated around 90km north of Visakhapatnam, in the Ananthgiri Hill Ranges of Eastern Ghats of India, is one of the largest caves in the Indian subcontinent. The caves are believed to be approximately 150 million years old. Located approximately 1,400 metres above sea level, the caves are known for their stalactite & stalagmite formations. #IncredibleIndia
comments: I visited this amazing caves.

message+desc: #IncredibleIndia is proud that Dipa Karmakar has qualified for the final round in the Individual vault final of artistic gymnastics, finishing eighth place with a score of 14.850. Dipa is the first Indian gymnast to enter the Olympic finals and is one among the only five gymnasts to have successfully performed the ‚ÄòProdunova‚Äô or the "vault of death" - one of the toughest manoeuvres in women‚Äôs gymnastics. She is also the first ever gymnast from India to be named as 'World Class Gymnast' by FIG.Wing's on Fire #Dipakarmakar #Rio2016

We are healed by this peaceful landscape.

Today‚Äôs picture is Tomonoura, Fukuyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture.
Tomonoura is a port town, situated at a bay facing the Seto Inland Sea, wonderful location to walking around.
You may find a lot of photogenic alleys lined by rustic old houses with wooden facades.

message+desc:
PSA: Forget the overcrowded Chatuchak full of tourists. Rod Fai has a new sister market Rod Fai II near the Thailand Cultural Center MRT - a huge relief to everyone because it is literally in the heart of the city. You no longer have to go through a painful 30-45 mins taxi ride to get there like before. And LOCALS come here. 

Visiting Rod Fai is very different experience from those just used to going to Chatuchak. It has FASHION, FOOD and BARS all lined up next to each other. But even this market is different from the old Rod Fai Market. 

We highly recommend Singaporeans to go here to avoid the other tourists and lepak with locals. Check out all the street food we ate!

See more pictures, the address and opening hours here!
http://thesmartlocal.com/read/rod-fai-ratchada

Note: This market is not super now. It has been opened since 2015 and there's also a Rod Fai III. But this is the most convenient to access and tons of people still do not know about it.

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com FB Page > Click on "Liked" and set Notifications to "All On"

Model: Audrey Faith and Symone Maria Oei

message+desc:
Local tourism has been increasingly gaining its deserved attention for the past few years. With the influx of people who travel, how can you say you got a meaningful travel escape? For @Vin_Aranas87, it's meeting new people and experiencing their culture and way of life.

"Last year, I had the chance to travel to Batanes with my friend, and the chance to experience Itbayat was a big tick off my travel bucket list. There we met Nanay Cano, a resident who operates a small lodging house. She is a retired teacher who also used to be a tourism officer in Itbayat. She fondly shared with us stories how she managed to juggle both responsibilities back in the day and how her love of Itbayat made it light for her to attend to her duties.

"Tourism has been a great help for her. Through tourism, she is able to practice her teaching profession she has always loved by imparting to her guests how to fully enjoy their stay in her hometown."

Story and Photo by: @vin_aranas87 

#TourismStoriesPHL
#itsMoreFunInThePhilippines
#VisitPhilippinesAgain2016
comments: What is the name of her lodge?$$JL Jo I remember the days when we stayed with Nanay Cano in Itbayat!

message+desc:
Last week, we've started featuring stories of people whose lives have improved because of tourism. These are successful stories of our tourism frontliners who prove how inclusive the tourism industry can be. Their stories are told by various local travelers around the Philippines whose journey would not have been more fun and much easier without the help they got from their newfound friends.

This week, we begin with the story of Jacob Maentz (@jacob.maentz on Instagram), a documentary and travel photographer from Cebu:

"I met Captain Angel Torres in Bais Bay during an early morning excursion to see the dolphins of Ta√±on Strait. Ta√±on Strait lies between Negros Oriental and Cebu and is the largest protected seascape in the country. It is home to spinner dolphins, dwarf sperm whales, spotted dolphins and pygmy killer whales. Today, a number of fishermen and other locals work part-time as captains or crew for some 15 boat tours around Ta√±on Strait, Angel being one of them. Visitors can get a glimpse of the marine mammals during early morning dolphin-watching trips.

"Back in the early 90‚Äôs dolphin meat was sold for P10 per kilo and was a common part of the local diet. Marine species would also be hunted for pure sport, mainly because no one knew any better explained Angel. In the mid-1990‚Äôs much of that changed when the LGU implemented a number of environmental laws to protect the dolphins and whales in the area.  Tourism now provides a livelihood for local fishermen and the marine life is better protected. "

Story and Photo by: Jacob Maentz (@Jacob.Maentz on Instagram)

#TourismStoriesPHL
#ItsMoreFuninThePhilippines
#VisitPhilippinesAgain2016
comments: I'm coming back to the Philippines in 2 days. Looking for outdoor activities to try$$Raymund Gaudiano Sande you shoul be here sir! my other friends / group of other friends wants to have a tour just like  what I had. And I prefer you.$$just like in Oslob, people were killing whale sharks to earn money, but when tourists started arriving, they shifted from killing whale sharks to accommodate tourists---earning MORE money than killing them. :)$$this sailor looks determined in what ever he does$$Over half of Philippine waters should be declared as marine sanctuaries. Keep the country clean and beautiful!$$Many people wait and push for the government to take action. But history tells us better that we can each take part in improving things ourselves without the expense and corruption that comes with government involvement.$$I miss the dolphins in bais city$$And so much more can be done if the politicians would only do something about it.$$:) USE WWW. ZEROLIKER, COM AND GET DAILY 2000  LIKES AND FOLLOWERS ON FACEBOOK USE IT SHARE IT MUST TRY FRIEND (y)

comments:
My name is Shig.
I am an engineer, who has a traditional Japanese middle age man face and body, working for a foreign company.
I have been living in Futakotamagawa, Setagaya ward, Tokyo with my wife and many turtles.
I want to be a conductor for around half day tour in Tokyo, in order to improve my English skill, to make many friends, to play Pokemon Go, and perhaps to encounter true loves in my summer vacation.
To ask me to go to the tour, please send me a friend request on Facebook, and let's talk on Facebook Messenger after we will be friends.
Name: Shigehiro Shig Matsuoka
Link: https://www.facebook.com/shigehiro.matsuoka
- You need to have your Face book account.
- Period until the end of Aug/2016.
- Any days Sun, Mon, Tue - Sat, and any time OK, but not always available.
- Any nationalities w/o Japanese, any sex, and any age available.
- Maximum 3 people at the same time.
- No need to pay money for me.
- Allow me to take photos of the participants and to contribute them to my page on Facebook.
- Pls check and decide where we go prior our tour. We can also talk about where we will go on Facebook Messenger.
- Pls realize the fact that I am not a professional tour conductor.
- I like singing songs at Karaoke very much.
- I like drinking beer at bar, Izakaya, and so on.
- I am a heavy smoker.
- I am in diet.
- I am really poor.
- I live in Futakotamagawa, so happy to visit close places.
- Shibuya is one of the closest major place but I don't like Shibuya so much.
- Futakotamagawa, Jiyugaoka, Nakameguro, Shinjuku, Ginza, Japanese emperor house ' Kokyo' and around those places would be nice for me.
- It would be nice for us to eat and/or drink "Cheap" Japanese traditional foods/drinks, enjoying chatting.

message+desc:
Mabuhay! Did you know that this Filipino word is now part of the Oxford English dictionary along with 25 others? Click on the link to see the other words that made it! Share this and share the pride! 

http://www.buzzfeed.com/aviannetan/like-hillary-clinton-is-a-presidentiable#.noYBxDJBQ"Halo-halo," "balikbayan," and "comfort room" are among dozens of new Filipino words in the Oxford English Dictionary.
comments:
Speaking of filipino language, every words we used are not mostly originated from our history. Most words we used are borrowed mostly from Spanish that colonized our country$$....Mabuhay!!! mga kababayan,balikbayan,  my batch mate,barkada and my ka barangay not to forget suki from the sari-sari store:  Then, let's have a gimmick. Don't forget to bring your baon,pasalubong with pandesal or better KKB.We have despidida for Ms. Kikay and her presidentiable kuya... Attire is Barong Tagalog for men while barot-saya   for ladies..The meals will be adobo&sinigang with pulutan.Our dessert is Ur fav halo-halo, splash down with buko juice... By;mrLeumas65$$I dont know if id be proud to have a filipino word in an english dictionary.$$These words are not part of the English language.  They were published for REFERENCE only!!$$For me its hard to speak Tagalog but I understand tagalog..cause I'm bisaya when I'm around with my friends some of them bisaya so I used to speak bisaya..so embarrassing they ignore me they didn't even talk to me..because they wanted me to learn Tagalog..they wanted me to speak Tagalog..then when I speak Tagalog they just laugh at me hardly...so I used English..one of my friend said this to me do not speak English or bisaya or else friendship is over...ugrr...I don't fucking care if they ignore me or what...will my Tagalog is better than before...lol...$$I'll have to remember KKB for the next time i'm in the Philippines! LOL I have already adapted Comfort Room or CR because it actually makes more sense than Restroom. I dont go to the CR to rest! right?$$Estafa, despidida, carnap, presidentiables are not entirely Pinoys as other countries use them as well, thus we cannot claim that these are Pinoy words in the OED$$Mabuhay Philippines üëèüëèüëèüëè
This is good news.$$I would like to add this:  The Tagalog language and all Filipino dialects lack the  legal, medical, scientific, mathematical, business,  literature, arts,  etc   terminology  that is why we rely on the English language to communicate  in business and  higher education.$$Kada is already in the dictionary long ago. Im not into linguistics but is it the word from barkada come from?$$Philippines don't have a lot of words in English ! I was here for 3 years now and I don't see it lol$$I was expecting "KILIG" to be one of them. ;)$$FYI in vernacular = 
‚Ä¢Utang na loob  = "debt of gratitude"
‚Ä¢Pandesal= called "bread of salt" as far as I know title of story accdg to our literature book in college
‚Ä¢Dutch treat= is kkb
‚Ä¢suki- regular customer
‚Ä¢despidida- simple as farewell party
‚Ä¢CR- comfort room /washroom/toilet whatever you call it (you say "bathroom" to take shower/bath -bath tub heyüòÅ)$$They should have include #Pabebe$$I¬¥m expecting  Barrio is one.

message+desc:
nanWe headed down to BAKE this morning on its opening day to find out if the hype was worth it. Lots of people in office attire were standing in the queue - they must have taken half-day leave just to line up!

This famous cheese tart shop from Hokkaido creates their cheese tarts using 3 different types of cheese with ingredients flown in from Japan.

Be prepared to queue till the hype dies down. Are the cheese tarts really that good? Find out in our video below!
Note: You'll only be able to buy 12 pcs at a go for now! (2 boxes).

Address: ION Orchard #B4-33, S238801
Price: $3.50 a piece.
Current wait: 2 hours+

The cookie-crust and combination of 3  cheeses makes the tarts taste exqusite, but it can get cloying afterawhile. So we recommend sharing and eating the tarts slowly.

Follow TheSmartLocal.com for more videos like this!
Journalist: Alicia Teng (Instagram: @aliciaatsh)

Oh yea, if you like Hokkaido, you might want to check out our guide to Hokkaido :)
http://thesmartlocal.com/read/visit-sapporo-hokkaido

message+desc:
Built in 1928, Iloilo's Nelly Garden  was the venue of many grand balls during the American and Japanese colonial period in the Philippines. Today, the majestic ancestral house is still in its original state and is a favorite venue for private functions among Ilonggos. Iloilo, where the past is always present!

ICYMI, here's our new TV commercial featuring more ancestral homes in Iloilo: http://youtu.be/nQJIB4rRkNI

message+desc:
Where is it?
Olango Islands, Cebu

How to Get There:
Olango Islands, Cebu

What is it?
This island group is composed of the main Olango Island and its six satellite islets. The site is a wildlife sanctuary that serves as a pit stop for migratory birds that come from as far as China, Japan and Siberia. 

Fun Fact:
The seven islands of the Olango group are joined together by a continuous reef. This makes the site a nice diving spot as well.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Jap Bautista

I lke i wan't to go the island hahaha mrning my dting :)^_^;)$$Yhufs! OlangO wAs sO nicE thEir bEach, and I alsO wEnt thEir turist spOt "thE birD sunctuArY" 8 wAs amAzing, sAna mka punta pa aqw uli doOn$$How to get there:
From airport, ride Punta Enga√±o multicab and disembark at Movenpick Hotel (for Hilton Port).
For Agsangil Wharf, ride Maribago-Soong multicab then disembark near Mactan Newtown. Take tricycle or habal habal to Agsangil Wharf.

Banca ride is 15 minutes, depending on weather conditions. You'll disembark at Santa Rosa Wharf at Olango island.

Hope this helps.

message+desc:
YUKATA is a casual summer kimono usually made of cotton. For some of you, its sounds like to be a popular Japanese souvenir. If you have a chance to visiting Japan in summer, you will have an opportunity to see people wearing YUKATA on various occasions and firework festival is a good choice, there are so many throughout Japan.
There is a YUKATA Festival in Himeji, Hyogo Prefecture on June 22 through 24 or Yukata Event in Nihonbashi on 11th July, Tokyo.
Men and women, children and adults‚Ä¶everyone can absolutely enjoy wearing YUKATA!!

>More information about YUKATA: 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/kie/puffy/kie_puffy_01.html
http://www.japantravelinfo.com/blog/getting-my-yukata-by-lindsay-mccoy/
>Himeji Yukata Festival:
http://www.hyogo-tourism.jp/english/whatsnew/index.php?id=871
>Fireworks:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1307/hanabi.html

i miss to wear my yukata$$i've bought one from Tokyo, I love it!!$$I have ever wear yukata,when i was in japan together with u,n i love it so much,wasn'right:?????$$I used to by myself a new yukata almost every year in Japan.  I also had a few jinbei, but prefer the yukata.

Now I've got one my mother-in-law found for me when she was working in a kimono shop and it's been sitting there nearly a decade, unworn.  

I've got the yukata, the geta, but no obi right now.  The other obstacle is that my wife's kimono and yukata are not here in the States, so I can't dress in yukata by myself.$$i love wearing yukata...$$luisa, you and aila went to wear yukata last year db?$$I have my picture in one!$$Love wearing a Yukata in summer! :-)

message+desc:
Started by two brothers from the UK, Char strives to improve the Cantonese food scene in Singapore, by amalgamating both Western and Chinese techniques. Char has also been included in the Singapore Michelin Guide book. If you drop by, be sure to order one of their beers or ciders. This mix of East and West flavours compliments each other nicely.

All DBS/POSB cardholders get 10% off weekday lunch + Complimentary "Exclusive DBS dish" for weekday nights and weekends with min. spend of S$50

Address: 363 Jln Besar, Singapore 208994
Opening Hours: 11:30am to 2:30pm and 6:00pm to 10:00pm

message+desc:
Part of the Marine Heritage Park, Sangalaki Island is one of the richest diving grounds in Indonesia. The uninhabited island which is part of Derawan Archipelago is surrounded by a wide lagoon and shallow reefs extending well out to sea. The currents vary from gentle to moderately strong; there‚Äôs no walls and little drift, just an abundance of rare and exotic marine life, including giant turtles and the famous schools of Manta rays or devil-fish. All in all, Sangalaki Island is the easiest place to see Manta rays during the day and sea turtle at night. 

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: I was there last June, it's an amazing place!$$Where is sangalaki Island in indon√©sian? How to get there ?$$Wish could be there someday with my family$$Beautiful... one day I'll be there

message+desc:
The 10th Sanur Village Festival: Environment and Galvanizing Community Involvement

Sanur Village Festival promises lots of fun, delicious food and plenty of excitement and gaiety for everyone, where this year the emphasis will  be on galvanizing community involvement to care more for the Environment and the continuation of local arts and culture. The Environment program includes cleaning of the beaches from unsightly flotsam and trash, the sending off  of baby turtles to sea, and planting  of  new coral reefs off the coast, all of which  will involve primary and secondary school students, members of the travel industry and NGOs. http://goo.gl/A7T4Ju #WonderfulIndonesia
